question: 岡山城
sourceMnemonic: This is the same <ja>岡山</ja> that you learned with <ja>岡山県</ja>. So what's Okayama <kanji>castle</kanji>? Yep, <vocabulary>Okayama Castle</vocabulary>!
sourceReadingMnemonic:
When <ja>城</ja> is added to a place name like this, it takes the on'yomi. You haven't learned this yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

The lord of <vocabulary>Okayama Castle</vocabulary> is none other than <reading>Jourm</reading> (<ja>じょう</ja>). How a farmhand managed to become the lord of a Japanese castle is beyond even us, but it's Lord Jourm to you now.
